boardgame.description: 1817 is a railroad operations and share trading board game in the 18xx series with a distinct financial flair. It is named after the year the New York Stock Exchange opened at 40 Wall Street in New York._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;1817 differentiates itself from other 18xx games with its sophisticated financial mechanics that simulate the laissez faire capitalism of early America. While all the familiar mechanics of an 18xx game are present, such as placing tiles, purchasing tokens, and running trains, the game is won or lost based on the financial decisions you make._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;1817 includes financial mechanics seen in other 18xx games such as mergers, friendly takeovers, and conversions to different share structures. Beyond these basics, 1817 introduces several additional financial mechanics such as short selling, market driven interest rates, hostile takeovers, and corporate liquidations. The most unique is selling stock short. Short selling is the practice of selling stock you don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;t own with the intention of buying the stock back at a later date. You hope to profit from a decline in the price of the stock between the sale and the repurchase. Conversely, you will incur a loss if the price of the stock increases before the repurchase. You are also liable for dividends paid while holding the short position._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: The Good, the Board, and the Busy Boy : Episode 142 Mr. Hamm goes to DFW for BGG Con 2017

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Played twice. DTG Ready to Play kit. Like new condition. Tokens mounted. No money.

Very nice PnP edition from 1817 prototype materials, by Andrew Tullsen @ Print and Play Productions (http://www.boardgamegeek.com/user/Howitzer_120mm). Includes mounted map _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; boards, mounted tiles, mounted charters, colored wooden tokens (stickered), additional shares for 10-short variant, red wooden cubes for loans . Some photos of this kit from Andrew: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/image/1108456/1817 http://www.boardgamegeek.com/image/1108464/1817 http://www.boardgamegeek.com/image/1108465/1817 http://www.boardgamegeek.com/image/1108457/1817 http://www.boardgamegeek.com/image/1108458/1817 http://www.boardgamegeek.com/image/1108459/1817 http://www.boardgamegeek.com/image/1108461/1817 http://www.boardgamegeek.com/image/1108462/1817 Note: this PnP version cost ~ $200, but I now own the final DTG version (available from All-Aboard Games for $248, with 10-shorts). Buyer pays shipping (US only).

US shipping is $13 The game is ready to play game with a quad-fold mounted board and is fully laminated and is prepared except stickers need to be mounted to the wood tokens. All games come without any paper money and players must supply a bank. Ships with other games offered by All-Aboard Games upon request (see website). Add $20 if you would like the extra variant shares (10 cut/laminated sheets).

This listing is for a copy of 1817 (All-Aboard Games). This copy includes the extra shares for the 10 short variant. Game is in like new shape, and has been bagged, with all stickers applied to tokens. Never played. Buyer pays $13.65 for shipping via USPS Priority Mail (medium flat rate box). I only ship to the US, and I only accept PayPal for payment. If you have any questions, please ask!
